intro: Irenea scabiosa, commonly known as the roughleaf irenea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
